title: Blue Origin makes impressive strides with reuse—next launch will refly booster
summary: With this quick turnaround, Blue Origin takes a step toward a faster cadence.

title: L3Harris to supply imager for Korean geostationary weather satellite
summary:
TAHOE CITY, Calif. — L3Harris Technologies will provide the primary imagery for the Korean Meteorological Administration’s (KMA) next-generation geostationary weather satellite. The contract, awarded to L3Harris by Korean aerospace manufacturer […]

title: NASA AI Model That Found 370 Exoplanets Now Digs Into TESS Data
summary: Trained on data from NASA’s exoplanet-hunting missions, the open-source ExoMiner++ deep learning model uses an advanced algorithm to validate new planets.

title: Tomorrow.io unveils DeepSky: constellation of large satellites and instruments
summary:
SAN FRANCISCO – Weather intelligence startup Tomorrow.io unveiled DeepSky, a satellite constellation designed to refine atmospheric forecasts by gathering the vast quantities of data needed to feed artificial intelligence models. […]

title: CNES Awards Loft Orbital Contract for French Radar Imaging Demo
summary:
The French space agency CNES awarded a contract to a consortium led by Loft Orbital to develop a synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imagery demonstrator. According to the company, the aim of the project is to foster the development of a “national radar imaging value chain.” Announced by Loft Orbital and consortium partner Thales Alenia Space […]
The post CNES Awards Loft Orbital Contract for French Radar Imaging Demo appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Rocket Lab suffers Neutron testing setback
summary:
A tank built for Rocket Lab’s Neutron rocket was damaged during qualification testing, threatening to further delay the vehicle’s first flight.
The post Rocket Lab suffers Neutron testing setback appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Arctic Weather Satellite paves way for constellation
summary: Already recognised for its excellence and even adopted for operational weather forecasting, the European Space Agency’s Arctic Weather Satellite has now fulfilled its most important role. This small prototype mission has succeeded in paving the way for a new constellation of similar satellites, known as EPS-Sterna.

title: D-Orbit raises $128 million in first tranche of Series D funding
summary:
SAN FRANCISCO – Italian space logistics specialist D-Orbit has raised $124 million in the first closing of a Series D investment round announced Jan. 22. “This funding will enable strategic acquisitions, accelerate the build-out of D-Orbit’s orbital logistics infrastructure, expand in-orbit transportation services, scale industrial capacity for ION missions and advance new operational capabilities required […]

title: A celebrity cluster in the spotlight
Snow Buries Kamchatka
summary: December and January brought a series of intense winter storms to the peninsula in far eastern Russia.
